description: The Women Scientist Scheme-C, implemented by the Department of Science and Technology, provides training in intellectual property rights (IPR), patents, and related fields for women scientists after a career break, enabling them to re-enter professional roles.
key_features: Training in IPR and patent management
Support for women scientists post-career break

benefits.stipend: Monthly stipend of Rs. 20,000 during training

education_criteria: Must hold a Masterâ€™s or Ph.D. in science, engineering, or medicine
additional_criteria: Must have a career break of at least 2 years

eligible_activities: Training in IPR, patent drafting, and technology transfer
Career counseling for re-entry into scientific roles

steps: Visit the Department of Science and Technology portal
Submit an online application with a resume and career break details
Upload required documents, including educational certificates
Applications are reviewed by a selection committee
Selected candidates are enrolled in the training program
application_process.note: Applicants must provide a statement of purpose

special_notes: Training is conducted at designated institutions
Applicants must commit to full-time training
Priority is given to women with research experience
